item.title: SSH Sudo Without Password Prompt
item.description: Ubuntu can use sudo without password prompt. the below is the step to enable it. open /etc/sudoers or create a file in /etc/ sudoers.d/ add a line user ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL done

item.title: SSH Login Without Password
item.description: Generate key ssh-keygen -t ed25519 [-C "your_email@example.com"] Upload public key to target PC two methods, upload via ssh-copy-id or manually Method 1 - ssh-copy-id ssh-copy-id remote_username@server_ip_address Method 2 - manually cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | ssh remote_username@server_ip_address "mkdir -p ~/.ssh && chmod 700 ~/.ssh && cat >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys && chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys" Update ssh server config remote to ssh server open /etc/ssh/sshd_config and modify as follow PasswordAuthentication no ChallengeResponseAuthentication no UsePAM no Restart restart PC or run follow command

item.title: Ubuntu - System Restart Required
item.description: TLDR To check update that caused system restart cat /var/run/reboot-required.pkgs To check changelog about the update xargs apt-get changelog < /var/run/reboot-required.pkgs reference https://linuxhandbook.com/system-restart-required-ubuntu/
